block-handbooktext-accumulator-tier1:
Allows storing electrical energy.
A charged battery can be carried if needed.
block-handbooktext-accumulator-tier2:
Allows storing electrical energy. A higher-capacity version of the standard battery.
A charged battery can be carried, but only in the bag slot.
block-handbooktext-ecable: Used to transmit electrical energy over distance.
block-handbooktext-switch: Allows breaking an electrical circuit. Installed on a cable. Click to toggle.
block-handbooktext-transformator:
Converts electrical energy from one voltage to another. Connect cables/devices to any two sides of the transformer!
Transformation ratio: 1:4.
game:gamemechanicinfo-electricalprogress:
Electricity: ElectricalProgressive Mod
This mod adds electricity, electrical devices, weapons, and armor to the game. These elements aim to enhance (or complicate) survival, reduce grind, and diversify gameplay.

Basics
The law of energy conservation states that energy cannot be created or destroyed, only converted or transferred. This applies in-game as well.

The primary source of mechanical energy is windmills. Generators convert mechanical energy into electrical energy. Connect a windmill to a generator via shafts/gears to start producing electricity.

Electrical energy can be transmitted via cables to consumers. Place cables in the desired direction. Up to 4 cables can be placed on each block face, allowing branching. Connect cables to the iron plate of a device to power it. Metal blocks also conduct electricity.

Since wind is inconsistent, generators may not produce enough energy. Use batteries to store excess energy and supply devices during low wind.

Use switches to disconnect unused devices and save energy. Install them on the circuit where needed.

For devices requiring mechanical energy, use engines. Engines convert electricity into mechanical energy. Connect them via shafts and ensure sufficient power.

Electricity: Engines and Generators
Engines and generators convert electrical and mechanical energy. Connect them via cables and shafts.

Game Mechanics
These devices simulate real-life DC machines. Key parameters:
- Torque: rotational force.
- Resistance torque: friction/losses.
Total torque determines shaft speed. If torque exceeds resistance, speed increases.

Generators
Parameters:
I_max: max output.
speed_max: nominal speed.
resistance_factor: resistance multiplier.
resistance_load: base resistance.
Power output: power = I_max *(1 – (|speed| / speed_max – 1)^4).
Resistance increases linearly below speed_max, quadratically above.

Engines
Parameters:
I_min: min input.
I_max: max input.
torque_max: max torque.
kpd_max: peak efficiency.
Efficiency peaks at 70% torque. Resistance follows similar rules as generators.
block-handbooktext-emotor-tier1:
Converts electrical to mechanical energy. Low power and speed.

Parameters:
I_min: 10;
I_max: 100;
torque_max: 0.5;
kpd_max: 0.75;
speed_max: 0.5;
resistance_factor: 0.1.
Details in guide.
block-handbooktext-emotor-tier2:
Upgraded engine with higher power and speed than the base engine.

Parameters:
I_min: 10;
I_max: 400;
torque_max: 1.0;
kpd_max: 0.85;
speed_max: 1.0;
resistance_factor: 0.1.

block-handbooktext-emotor-tier3:
High-performance engine with superior power. Better than upgraded engines.

Parameters:
I_min: 10;
I_max: 800;
torque_max: 2.0;
kpd_max: 0.95;
speed_max: 1.0;
resistance_factor: 0.1.
Details in guide.

speed_max: 0.5;
resistance_factor: 0.1;
resistance_load: 0.25.

item-handbooktext-engineshaft: Used in engines/generators and other rotating devices.
